body:

Thanks for the very quick response!
I realize that immediately after sending you my error message. I forgot to change the settings in the configuration file (and my path is stata_path = "/Applications/Stata/StataIC.app/Contents/MacOS/stata-ic" and I set the execution_mode = automation since there is no console version for Stata IC, right?)
However, I am still having similar issues as before. The Kernel still does not work and appear to "die" few seconds after opening a file in Jupiter notebook. It seems that the 'StataKernel' from the file "__init__.py" cannot be imported from 'stata_kernel'. I am not sure how to fix this...
These are the error messages that appear on my terminal:
/opt/anaconda3/envs/Stata/bin/jupyter_mac.command ; exit;

> stata_path = "/Applications/Stata/StataIC.app/Contents/MacOS/stata-ic"

that path doesn't exist on your computer. It should be `StataIC` instead of `stata-ic` I think. When it's correct you should be able to paste it in your terminal and open stata

Yes, I also tried as you proposed it but it did not work (and also tried it in my terminal and Stata opened). I tried just in case with  the lower case ("Stata-ic) as you proposed here https://www.qdxingtu.com/key/Stata%20for%20Mac%20Kernel%20Restarts.html, but both do not work. With stata_path = "/Applications/Stata/StataIC.app/Contents/MacOS/StataIC I get the same error as above.
Maybe include the path without quotes in the config file. Otherwise feel free to browse old issues but I don't have other suggestions.
I am also having a similar issue ImportError: cannot import name 'StataKernel' from 'stata_kernel' (/Users/aditya/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/stata_kernel/__init__.py)
